benchmark_details.name: DecompileBench
benchmark_details.overview: DecompileBench is the first comprehensive framework for evaluating decompilers in reverse engineering workflows, integrating real-world function extraction, runtime-aware validation, and automated human-centric assessments using LLM-as-Judge.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic framework for evaluating decompilers and assist security experts in choosing appropriate tools based on specific requirements.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Evaluation is limited to x86-64 architectures; limited human validation with a small sample size.

data.source: Extracted from OSS-Fuzz projects capturing 23,400 real-world functions from 130 programs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated via runtime consistency checks and side effect analysis during program execution.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better functionality preservation and understandability in decompilation.
methodology.baseline_results: Evaluated against performance of existing industrial-strength decompilers.
methodology.validation: Validated by comparing outputs with expert ratings using Cohen's kappa.
